Most Illustrious and Excellent Sir,

Certainly Your Excellency Colonel Lebério must be awaiting orders, and having been informed that perhaps the government will be set in motion, therefore I await of Your Excellency Your Excellency Your Excellency.

From São Gabriel I had written to you regarding the same matter, whose letter is in the possession of the wife of godfather José Mariano and, were it not for the reasons that occurred, certainly I would not have taken such a step without the deliberation of Your Excellency.

The health of Your Excellency.

From Your Excellency’s Friend, many thanks,
Antônio José de Abreu

Nota Bene Your Excellency

Most Illustrious and Excellent Sir Domingos José de Almeida. Alegrete.

Received and answered on August 28, 1840.
